Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery top band stemless cup; interior: glazed black with reserved band at rim; exterior: lip black with dilute brown band below; in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of front half of centaur with horse’s ear, gallopping to right, holding stone in each hand (dabs in added red on hair and beard); trace of black below scene.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the shape, see Würzburg 428 (Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 184). For parallels regarding the centaurs, see Baur, P. V. C., Centaurs in Ancient Art. Berlin 1912, 34, no. 91; see also the lip cup, Munich 2161 (CVA Munich 10, pl. 15, no. 1-4).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.54)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 404, no. B603)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0668) (Phase 1)
